definition[0]: the bottom part of a tree that is left in the ground after the rest of it has been cut down
definition[1]: the short part of someoneâ€™s leg, arm etc that remains after the rest of it has been cut off
definition[2]: the small useless part of something that remains after most of it has broken off or worn away
example[1]: There was only a stump of the candle left.
definition[3]: one of the three upright sticks in cricket that you throw the ball at
definition[4]: if you are stumped by a question or problem, you are unable to find an answer to it
example[2]: a case that has stumped the police
example[3]: The doctors were stumped and had to call in a specialist.
explanation[0]: Stump is usually passive in this meaning
definition[6]: to put a batsman out of the game in cricket by touching the stumps with the ball when he is out of the hitting area
definition[7]: to travel around an area, meeting people and making speeches in order to gain political support
example[5]: Alexander has been stumping in New Hampshire.
